head.supplied: 10/8/87. ¶ ¶ Your letter, dear Mr Barnard, ¶ I handed to Mr Macdonald last evening, so that he may bring before the next Council meeting of the geographic Society ¶ the proposition made by the Club...

div.p: FNCV 015-028, Archives, Field Naturalists Club of Victoria, Melbourne.

Your letter, dear Mr Barnard,
Letter not found. I handed to Mr Macdonald last evening, so that he may bring before the next Council meeting of the geographic Society
The Victorian Branch of the Royal Geographical Society of Australasia. the proposition made by the Club. The Council will very soon come together. Individually I will give the proposition my best support, that large reserves should be made at the Promontory;
Wilson's Promontory, Vic. For the Council's support for the reservation of Wilson's Promontory, see M to F. Barnard, 1 September 1887. but I would advise, that the Club also press for extensive reservations in the Waratah-Country of East Gippsland,
Vic. "the Australian Switzerland" just opened up.
